name: headscale-cli
description: CLI for headscale, an open-source implementation of the Tailscale control server

repo.name: headscale
repo.description: An open source, self-hosted implementation of the Tailscale control server

readme.summary: Clear explanation of what the project does, but critically lacks installation instructions, usage examples, and troubleshooting guidance in the README itself.
readme.top_issue: No installation or usage instructions in README - only links to external documentation with warnings about version mismatches and discouragement of common deployment methods

injection_risks.description: The 'req' variable in the getGHCRTags function is created with a URL that includes user-controlled input (ghcrTagsURL), but it does not appear to be directly influenced by external inputs. However, the 'token' variable used in the Authorization header could potentially be manipulated if an attacker gains access to the GHCR token endpoint.
The 'rawURL' variable is constructed using a format string with user-controlled input (patchVer), but it does not appear to be directly influenced by external inputs.

critical_findings: Potential for GHCR token manipulation in tools/capver/main.go
Lack of input validation for the 'directory' flag and 'test-pattern' argument
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and lack of input validation, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good practices.

common_complaints: ACL and access control bugs affecting functionality
Crashes and crashes during node state transitions
sentiment.summary: Headscale-cli shows moderate community health with active issue reporting and some maintainer engagement, but several unresolved bugs and missing features indicate room for improvement in responsiveness and feature completeness.

red_flags: repeated closure of issues without clear resolution
lack of detailed explanations for decisions
communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally adequate but could be more patient and clearer, especially when dealing with repeated or basic questions.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite being on the main branch as recently as January 26, 2026
104 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in the past 6 months indicating no maintenance activity
No merged PRs in the past 6 months showing no active development
Zero active contributors in the past 6 months
Last release date is unknown, suggesting prolonged stagnation
positive_signals: Repository still exists and has not been deleted
maintenance.summary: headscale-cli is effectively abandoned with zero maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a large backlog of open issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized, clearly marks breaking changes and provides detailed migration guidance.

governance.summary: The project lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, posing high bus factor risk.

project_metrics.description: An open source, self-hosted implementation of the Tailscale control server

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is informative but lacks clear installation and troubleshooting instructions, making it difficult for new users to get started.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear installation instructions and a quick start guide
Community: [Bug] Unknown users break group policies. Deleted users do not correctly propagate.
Community: [Bug] CurAddr isn't updated on Windows clients when a Linux client is restarted
Communication: repeated closure of issues without clear resolution
Communication: lack of detailed explanations for decisions
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
Security: Potential for GHCR token manipulation in tools/capver/main.go
Security: Lack of input validation for the 'directory' flag and 'test-pattern' argument
highlights: High number of commits in the past six months (208)
A significant number of merged PRs in the past six months (144)
Multiple contributors active in the past six months (27)
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
